basic.description: This course explores Arab cinema from the colonial period to the present, examining the cultural personifications that distinguish it from Hollywood cinema. It provides an in-depth exploration of cultural identity and politics in the Arab World. Through cinematographic images and readings, students engage in the history of cultural, political, and religious diversity within dynamically changing Arab societies. Taught in English. All movies have English subtitles.
basic.subject: IFS
basic.title: Through an Arabic Lens: The Intersection of Film and Culture
